cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, then west-northwest across the northern Leeward Islands toward the Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Turks and Caicos, Bahamas, and eventually Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Guadeloupe, Dominican Republic north coast to Haiti north coast, Turks and Caicos Islands, and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Antigua, Barbuda, Anguilla, Montserrat, St. Kitts & Nevis, Saba, St. Eustatius, Sint Maarten, Saint Martin, Saint Barthelemy, British Virgin Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through the U.S. and British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds will begin tonight with a 50% peak probability Wednesday; hurricane-force gusts are possible as the core passes just north.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Around 1–2 ft of surge above normal tides expected along St. Croix’s coast, accompanied by large breaking waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–10 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 15 inches could cause flash flooding and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and destructive surf, dangerous rip currents, and reduced visibility could hamper port operations.
